cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 140 mi NW of San Juan, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest toward the Turks & Caicos, Bahamas, and then curving north toward the Florida peninsula

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for Florida at this advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for Florida at this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Turks & Caicos, southeastern and central Bahamas now; Florida peninsula and adjacent Gulf/Atlantic coasts later in the period
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are now a 52 % cumulative risk in the next five days, with a 25 % chance of sustained 50-kt winds at the port as the core passes inland Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If Irma approaches from the south and tracks up the west coast, on-shore flow could push 3–6 ft of surge into Tampa Bay and lower Manatee River.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands associated with Irma could drop 4–8 in+ of rain, producing flash-flood potential around Port Manatee.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas and long-period swells beginning this weekend will disrupt vessel scheduling and cargo operations.
